column5: How severe/frequent is it for you?
That‚Äôs good insight to have. But nah if it helps with all that I don‚Äôt see why it wouldn‚Äôt help with mental diagnoses as well
I haven‚Äôt heard that yet, but will keep it in mind. Have you noticed a difference from the diet
I feel you I do the same thing often times I‚Äôll keep my tv on, so it‚Äôs not completely dark or quiet.
I get them but for me it‚Äôs shadowed figures in corners.
I agree. For me it‚Äôs a gradual thing. Day by day I feel as if I‚Äôm slipping further and further away, almost as if I‚Äôm fading out. Ify man.
I try not to read too much into it. But when I can‚Äôt help but think about it, I just let it happen.
Right. You just don‚Äôt know what it is. You can just physically feel something that is mentally wrong.
I guess I‚Äôll have to do try n do the same:)
Ify it‚Äôs been going on w me for a minute too. Don‚Äôt think about it too much.
It hasn‚Äôt gotten to this degree with me yet, although I feel I might be close. I am already on trazadone mirtazapine and adderall, and don‚Äôt want to be on anymore meds.
Ofc:)
I have a lot of triggers as well, but good luck with your pregnancy, stay safe and healthy so your baby will come out healthy as well.
And I can‚Äôt tell if they mean something or not, I get on edge when I see one because it has to mean something good or bad.
I also see butterflies all day everyday sometimes two flying together sometimes one, before I started Experiencing all these other things, I had seen butterflies but not to this extent.
Do you have any insight as to what causes this for you?
You‚Äôre welcome. It took me a couple minutes to figure out how to put itüòÇ but this happens to you?
It is. Especially when you‚Äôre trying to get an important point across, and you just forget. 9 times out of 10 when I‚Äôm speaking a sentence I have to say ‚Äú damn I forgot what I was gonna say‚Äù

I do have Truman delusions to some degree, such as everything in the world is centered around me and that my interactions with new people, are staged to see how I react and sometimes I feel as if the world around me is a stage of sorts. But I can‚Äôt tell if they are hallucinations, or if they are real things. For example, when I was pulling out of my neighborhood, as I came to a stop I noticed a pigeon perched on top of the stop sign with its head cocked sideways staring maliciously at me, and it‚Äôs head followed me as I drove away. I couldn‚Äôt stop thinking about it.

Thank you. Not many people do which is strange. I have yet to have any brain damage, yet I do find myself stuck quite often, I will stop in the middle of a sentence because the thought just wasn‚Äôt there anymore. I also say thing and explain things in ways that make people ask me ‚Äúwhat I‚Äôm talking about‚Äù
Tolerance is where the issue comes in with everything
What makes you feel that way?
I agree. I just don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs wrong with me I know my symptoms but I feel like I have symptoms indicative of several mental illnesses

Did you find yourself overthinking everything during your Prodromal phase? I find that I think a lot about pointless shit, like wondering if a trash can that was knocked over was like that for me to see, or if everything I do is already planned out

Seeing minor disturbances out of the corner of my eye is 24/7 but I often see things like birds or cats doing weird things or seeing bugs and I wonder every time if I‚Äôm actually seeing these things.
I feel that, I think we both share the same issue, that issue being the amount of insight we have into ourselves.

I appreciate the response. It‚Äôs been like this for a year or two now and I feel like I‚Äôm just sitting here waiting to completely loose it, I started to ask myself if I‚Äôve just been tripping out because my symptoms have been so gradual rather than instantaneous.
Do they last? Mine are instantaneous and it makes me wonder if it really just happened.

I‚Äôve actually found that Xanax helps with staying asleep the whole night. Someone suggested ambien but I don‚Äôt think ambien is as strong as trazadone or mirtazapine, as far as sleep goes, but it‚Äôs hard to compare the three due to two of them being from a completely different class of drugs.
How long have you been on it? At first it worked for me but now I am on trazadone and mirtazapine for sleep and anxiety and it doesn‚Äôt work
Try trazadone.
But if it‚Äôs happens consistently, that‚Äôs a whole different story.

I appreciate all the responses. I‚Äôve been hearing things I‚Äôm just not sure what they are they sound like whispers, clicks, static, songs etc. Only difference is that I can tell something‚Äôs off in my head I‚Äôm just not sure what.
Too much hype I have a 12 pound blanket and it doesn‚Äôt do shit
What were your symptoms? And how severe were they?
I always get the glitches.
I feel you forreal
It‚Äôs been gradual for me but it‚Äôs gotten way worse recently within the past couple of weeks
How long before your break did these things start for you?
I appreciate thatüòå

It all depends on your reasons for wanting to be friends. It would be wrong IMO to ‚Äúbreak up‚Äù with him based off the fact that he his mentally unstable. Now, if you guys already had relationship problems before hand, you should not feel guilt tripped to continue to be with him. If that is truly how you are feeling, I would recommend waiting until he is in a better place mentally as you telling him how you‚Äôre feeling atm could lead to him becoming more unstable.

DO NOT leave him. I was locked up for nine months and all I wanted was to be back w my girl been taken away from her several times for different reasons and she stayed, it‚Äôll help him get better if you stay there for him.
And also because of how weird these experiences feel.
There‚Äôs a lot of shit troubling me, and I‚Äôve personally ruled out anxiety primarily because I have anxiety attacks when all this happens.

I‚Äôm on 150 mg of trazadone for this same reason, worked at first but doesn‚Äôt anymore I still have yet to find a medication that works, but have taken seroquel recreationally and that shit works very well. Another thing about trazadone is it really fucks you up, but like you said doesn‚Äôt last.

It‚Äôll all be good bro trust that. I‚Äôve lost a lot of people close due to homicide/suicide or anything for that matter. This feeling will get better with hope and time, but having a pessimistic view will only tear you apart. Stay strong and push through.
I appreciate the insight. Every time I go to do it something in my head tells me not to, or to just put it off until the next appointment, but hopefully something changes soon, thank you again.
I appreciate the insight forreal.

I have some of these same issues, when walking in public I feel as though I tend to walk and move around weird, because I am certain that I am being watched through every open window etc. as far as the bugs go, I constantly feel bugs crawling underneath the skin on my wrists and on my neck almost leading me to want open my wrists to relieve the feeling. Regarding the persistent checking of doors to make sure they are locked, and searching the bed for bugs it sounds more like OCD.
